text:
You could possibly use this regex_replace and then make sure it doesnâ€™t return any numbers?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#regex-replace>

<@U01S7VCCTBN>
```{% set string = "stringwithnumber123" %}

{% set containsNumber = string|regex_replace("[0-9]+", "") %}

{{ (containsNumber == string) ? 'yes' : 'No' }}```
is there a function to auto minify css inside <style> tags in a module.html
Not sure if it minifies it or not but it does remove it from the DOM and I believe adds it to the module.css on compile (which should then minify it).
scope adds the module_id as an 'id' in the css for specificity.
It's not necessary for what you were asking but it is nice for if you have multiple instances of the module the css wont clash

I was having trouble finding a good pagination snippet, <https://gist.github.com/ianhoyte/47380f485f9bcfcdf7a558636dee7f8c|so I ended up building my own>. It adds in some extra functionality from Jason Rosa's "<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/us/dontgojasonwaterfalls-blog-numbered-pagination|Blog Numbered Pagination>" which I feel greatly improves UX. Feel free to use/modify, whatever.
